story: The Iteration Academy needs teaching materials. Explain when to use direct iteration vs indexing, and safe patterns for mutation.
instructions: Explain when to prefer `for x in xs` vs `for i in range(len(xs))`, when to use `enumerate`, and safe ways to modify lists during iteration.

explainRubric.description: Mentions enumerate for when you need both index and value
Recommends direct iteration when you don't need indices
Provides safe patterns (iterate over copy or use comprehension)

hints.text: Prefer `for item in items:` when you only need values. Use `for i, item in enumerate(items):` when you need both index and value.
Avoid modifying a list while iterating over it directly. Iterate over a copy: `for item in items[:]:`
Best for filtering: use list comprehension `items = [x for x in items if condition]` instead of removing during iteration.

title: Explain: Prefer Iteration Patterns
